slim_seo.title: I Feel Free - The Drake
slim_seo.description: This event is by the people, for the people. This is provide a platform to showcase some of the best DJs in the City as well as the hottest upcoming talent. Reserve your free online ticket now. DJs @natural.wav @djmegs_ @djstefaunie @djzartv PERFORMANCE BY: @delan0che @amaiahalexis HOSTs @lostatsleep @sh.akk @saraslivee @yongefame @chriispyy222

slim_seo.title: Stacey Ryan - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Stacey Ryan is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist known for her genre-blending sound that fuses pop, R&B, jazz, and soul. Rising to fame with her viral hit “Don’t Text Me When You’re Drunk,” she quickly gained international attention for her powerful voice, musicality, and relatable lyrics. With her debut EP I Don’t Know What Love Is, Stacey continues to build a loyal fanbase drawn to her heartfelt storytelling and vibrant energy.

slim_seo.title: Bo Staloch - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Born and raised in Austin TX, Bo Staloch is an up-and-coming singer-songwriter based in Nashville. Through the release of his debut single ‘Springtime Red Tulips’, he has gained the attention of many, including some of his biggest idols and inspirations. Bo has a very unique sound that blends the worlds of Americana, Country, Folk and Pop. He takes listeners on a wild journey through his extremely vivid storytelling capabilities. Keep your ears and eyes open for a ton of new music from Bo soon!

slim_seo.title: With Love, Irvin - The Drake
slim_seo.description: New York electronic R&B singer & producer Rahmaan is creating a sound all their own with experimental soundscapes and culturally-rich melodies. Their new album ‘with love, Irvin’ is out now to take you on a journey through nuance. Enter the live experience here at Drake Underground.

slim_seo.title: BOLDEN - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Bolden. is a captivating jazz‑house duo merging live jazz improvisation with electronic house beats. Drawing from deep jazz roots and modern dance energy, they deliver immersive, genre‑blurring performances—bringing smoky club atmospheres to festival dancefloors .

slim_seo.title: BOLDEN - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Bolden. is a captivating jazz‑house duo merging live jazz improvisation with electronic house beats. Drawing from deep jazz roots and modern dance energy, they deliver immersive, genre‑blurring performances—bringing smoky club atmospheres to festival dancefloors .

slim_seo.title: LOVEFOXY - The Drake
slim_seo.description: LOVEFOXY, a Berlin-born DJ, has quickly become a standout in house music. Rooted in ’90s house and Berlin’s legendary scene, she’s played Boiler Room, Berghain, and major festivals like Tomorrowland and ADE. Her 2024 debut EP Burning Down the Sluthouse dropped on Nervous Records, followed by remixes from Ian Pooley and Malugi. With upcoming releases on Warehouse Project Records and Rek’d, plus a Badaboum residency, LOVEFOXY is solidifying her status as a bold, boundary-pushing force in global dance music.

slim_seo.title: 54 ULTRA - The Drake
slim_seo.description: 54 Ultra is the solo project of New Jersey-based singer, songwriter, and producer John Anthony. Fusing synth‑driven indie rock with Latin‑soul rhythms, his nostalgic, melodic garage‑pop sound shines through smooth vocals and tasteful production

slim_seo.title: Cicadachar - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Cicadachar makes her Drake Underground Debut alongside Malory & Nick Posthumus and the Soft Maybes.

slim_seo.title: RamRiddlz - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Ramriddlz is a Toronto-based artist known for his melodic blend of dancehall, R&B, and hip-hop. Rising to fame with his viral hit “Sweeterman” — later remixed by Drake — Ramriddlz has built a cult following with his playful lyrics, tropical-infused sound, and genre-blurring style. His music reflects his multicultural background and a carefree, experimental approach to modern rap and R&B.

slim_seo.title: Desi Trill - The Drake
slim_seo.description: BROWN IS EVERYWHERE – Part Two After a packed night on June 6th in Toronto, we’re back with our second summer drop—featuring Mrii, Brisky, and special guest VANI from the Bay Area. Hosted by FENIFINA. The first event set the tone, following roadblock vibes at Soho House London, Kindred with Bombay Mami, and a legendary Mumbai night at @khar.social. VANI blends afrobeats, baile funk, desi fusion & more—fresh off an India tour and sets with Jyoty, Priya Ragu & KSHMR. A global force in the making. Pull up. Bring your crew.#BrownIsEverywhere @desitrill

slim_seo.title: Tommy Prine - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Tommy Prine’s debut album This Far South is a deeply personal reflection on loss, love, and growth in his 20s. Co-produced by Ruston Kelly and Gena Johnson, the record blends cathartic jams with intimate storytelling. Influenced by artists from Gillian Welch to Outkast, Prine developed his own guitar style by watching his father and crafts songs that explore existential questions and emotional truth.

slim_seo.title: Yussi - The Drake
slim_seo.description: YUSSI is an emerging Australian Drum & Bass artist bringing forth the “JUST GO SKITZ” Sonic Experience; to Up Your Energy and Face The Adrenaline. His production methods which have been developed over years have cultivated a recognizable and unique sound you will hear tearing through the sets of big names in the scene such as Kanine, Luude, AC13, Grafix, Tsuki, Sigma, K Motionz, ShockOne, Gray, Mollie Collins, Kumarion, AMC, Andy C, TC, Disrupta & Koven. Whilst the project has only just kicked off in 2022, YUSSI has already built up a sizable release catalogue. With no sign of stopping he is quickly solidifying his position as a powerhouse producer in the modern DnB scene to watch closely over coming years.

slim_seo.title: The Boneheads - The Drake
slim_seo.description: The Boneheads celebrate the release of their latest single “Lonesome Cowboy” at The Drake Underground. Pre-save: https://distrokid.com/hyperfollow/theboneheads1/lonesome-cowboy The Boneheads have taken the Toronto music scene by storm with their blues-tinged rock ‘n’ roll. By combining old school and modern influences, their music will bring a familiarity of the golden age of the blues with contemporary rock expression. Joining them are the 2023 97.7 HTZ-FM Rocksearch Champion blues/roots rock trio Gravely, as well as alternative rock trio Gone Out.

slim_seo.title: Noah Floersch - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Hailing from Omaha, Nebraska and based now in Nashville, Noah Floersch has been releasing smart and stirring pop music since his college years at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. When the single “Ghost of Chicago” from his second record Noah unexpectedly went viral, racking up millions of streams just about overnight, it allowed Floersch to quit his job at an ice prep factory and head out on his first major tours — including a support slot for Ricky Montgomery, and a headline tour at the end of last year. Now, taking on board the lessons he’s learned about connecting in a live setting, he debuts a new era with the sad-boy singalong anthem, “Growing Everything Out”. Inspired by the rougher side of his new on-the-road lifestyle, it’s a track about looking in the mirror, realizing you look like shit, and not even caring. Beneath its playful “na-na-na”s and its earworm melodies is a genuinely poignant mix of sadness and exhaustion, relatable to anyone who’s found themselves the worse for wear in a bathroom stall a few too many times. “Growing Everything Out” and the new music still to come sees Floersch grappling with his least flattering emotional impulses, at the same time as crafting the most undeniably fun songs of his career. It’s a combination of vulnerability and charisma that builds on the meaningful connection he’s already built with fans, and completes his transformation into a bona fide pop star.

slim_seo.title: Ken Yates - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Ken Yates is an award-winning singer-songwriter known for his introspective blend of folk, indie, and rock. His 2025 album Total Cinema, produced by Dan Ledwell, explores themes of gratitude and self-awareness with emotional clarity. Praised by NPR’s Ann Powers and Atwood Magazine, the album’s eleven tracks mark a bold step forward in Yates’ sound. Following his 2022 release Cerulean—nominated at the Canadian Folk Music Awards—Yates has performed at SXSW and Americanafest, opened for Madison Cunningham and Passenger, and collaborated with artists like Katie Pruitt and Lori McKenna.

slim_seo.title: Yalla - The Drake
slim_seo.description: It’s time again, Yalla Comedy is back with a new show, lineup and vibes. In celebration of Pride Month, we will be donating our net proceeds to Rainbow Railroad who help LGBTQI+ refugees escape persecution.

slim_seo.title: Michelle Owen & The Works - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Calling all Toronto music lovers! A CAN’T MISS headline performance by Michelle Owen & The Works live at Drake Underground on August 28th. Get ready for an incredible night of music featuring sets by the talented Jon Green & Cassidy Taylor. End your summer with an unforgettable evening featuring some of Toronto’s best new emerging artists. See you there!

slim_seo.title: Tom Aspual - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Tom Aspaul is an acclaimed independent pop artist known for his infectious, disco-infused sound and bold, theatrical performances. Fresh off a UK tour with Kesha and standout festival sets across Europe, he launches Cabin Fever Live—his biggest headline tour yet—celebrating the critically acclaimed 2025 album Cabin Fever. A former songwriter for Kylie Minogue and Becky Hill, Aspaul rose to prominence with 2020’s Black Country Disco and continues to cement his place as a vital queer voice in modern pop.

slim_seo.title: Night Swim - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Dive into some deep mixes by Kwu, Queen KJB, and Mike Gnocato

slim_seo.title: BIG SIS - The Drake
slim_seo.description: FINALLY A GOOD F*CKING DANCE PARTY! BIG SIS is a sibling duo from Liverpool. Their music combines cheeky lyricism with infectious dance beats. Many of their tracks illicit a nostalgia for first wave euro pop, though our their live performances have been touted as refreshing and leading edge.

slim_seo.title: Kumo 99 - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Kumo 99 is a digital hardcore duo made up of Ami Komai and Nate Donmoyer. Blending explosive electronic beats with raw punk energy, they deliver a fierce, genre-defying sound rooted in underground club culture and DIY ethos.

slim_seo.title: Stolen Gin - The Drake
slim_seo.description: We’re Stolen Gin, a dance-funk quintet from New York City. We’re known for our high-energy live act and avid improvisation – we never play songs the same way twice. We first came together playing college parties on NYC rooftops, and our goal then was the same as it is now: to make every gig feel like a party, and to keep people dancing.

slim_seo.title: Marina Satti - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Singer, songwriter and music producer Marina Satti was born in Athens, Greece to a Sudanese father and Cretan mother. Marina graduated in classical piano, advanced music theory and classical singing, before receiving a scholarship from the internationally acclaimed Berklee College of Music. At Berklee, Marina studied orchestration, production and jazz, while working with renowned artists, such as Danilo Perez and Jamie Haddad, among others. Marina Satti has developed a unique sound that combines the different musical traditions she grew up with, such as Greek, Arabic and Balkan with urban elements and rhythm.

slim_seo.title: Demxntia - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Demxntia is a Vietnamese artist from Tampa, FL, known for his genre-blending sound that fuses R&B, hip-hop, and alternative. With over 500 million streams and 140K Spotify followers, he’s built a global fanbase through deeply emotional music that explores love, pain, and self-reflection. Dropping out of high school at 16 to pursue music, he’s remained fully independent since 2017, steering his own path without a label. His viral hits like “Tonight” and collaborations with artists like Keshi and Kid Travis have solidified his status, recently culminating in a sold-out international tour in China.

slim_seo.title: Presley Regier - The Drake
slim_seo.description: At just 22, Presley Regier is redefining male pop stardom and leading a new wave of rising artists. He began producing music at 13 using YouTube tutorials and was collaborating with industry names by 15. Before turning 21, he had already written, produced, and recorded for major artists like Doja Cat, Big Sean, Kevin Abstract, and Tyga. In 2023, he released his debut EP Run, then joined global pop star Tate McRae on the North American leg of her Think Later Tour, where he dropped his breakout single “They Know I’m Bored” during a sold-out Madison Square Garden show. The buzz led to sold-out headliners in New York and L.A. and the release of Questions / Nightly, a two-pack featuring a remix with Ari Abdul. With millions of streams and undeniable momentum, Presley Regier is poised to become pop’s next breakout act. His highly anticipated new EP, SPILL, drops June 27, 2025.

slim_seo.title: Case Oats - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Baseball caps and horsetails, porch swings and “all else that fails”—these are the lyrical stomping grounds of Case Oats, the group led by Casey Walker and Spencer Tweedy. Transplanted from Missouri to Chicago, Walker has a knack for getting to the “gooey heart” of relationships and experience, of bringing a city-dwelling life back down to earth. With an unadorned delivery and an unflinching eye, Walker relates songs about moving on, about growing up in the Midwest, and about loyalty to desperately flawed people and gratitude for pain, for the way things end up.   Case Oats’ yet-to-be-announced debut album is a well-defined, inviting labor of love. Light on pastiche and heavy on intention, their arrangements, backed by a group of longtime collaborators, put Case Oats on a continuum of porch-sitting, familiar songwriters

slim_seo.title: Banshee - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Banshee is an American metal singer and music producer renowned for pioneering SirenCore, a genre that fuses ethereal vocals with heavy metal elements. She burst onto the scene in 2018 with her explosive debut single “Fk with a Witch,”** and has since carved out a cult following with powerful tracks like “Birth of Venus,” “Kill All Predators,” and “Death of a Predator.” Her music is fearless and unfiltered, tackling themes of trauma, mental health, and self-empowerment. As a fully independent artist, Banshee writes, produces, and performs all of her work, building a fiercely devoted fanbase known as the Cult of Banshee—or to the diehards, the Stanshees.

slim_seo.title: SOPHIA TICE - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Sophia Tice is an independent artist, songwriter, and producer with music on all streaming platforms. Born in London and raised in Toronto, she now lives in NYC, studying at NYU’s Clive Davis Institute. She recently launched her own label, SW19 Records. Sophia has performed at major Canadian and NYC venues, including the TD Toronto Jazz Festival, The Rex Hotel, and Arlene’s Grocery. She’s shared the stage with acclaimed artists like John McDermott, Drew Jurecka, and DALA, and performed for Prince Edward. As an artist ambassador, she supports causes including Lighthouse for Grieving Children and Special Olympics.

slim_seo.title: Maiah Manser x GUS - The Drake
slim_seo.description: GUS 24-year-old Toronto native GUS writes feverishly about summer, friendships, growing up, and moving away from home. Inspired by storytelling indie artists, he’s been making music for over a decade. After university, he moved to LA to pursue songwriting full-time, working across genres from indie to hyper-pop. GUS has played showcases in LA and Toronto, toured with Johnny Orlando worldwide, and recently supported LØLØ on her European tour—with more shows coming in North America. His music is introspective, electric-guitary, and always honest—strange song titles included. Maiah Manser Maiah Manser is a Los Angeles-based vocalist, producer, and composer known for blending fantasy-inspired soundscapes with haunting, ethereal vocals. Her work has earned praise from The Fader, Nylon, and KEXP, with placements in Lucifer, Tidelands, Immaculate, and more. A viral snippet of her song “With A Smile” earned 35 million views across TikTok and Instagram. Maiah’s upcoming EP Fourth Wall, out Fall 2024 on Arista Records, explores our obsession with fame and success. Hiroki Tanaka is a Toronto-based guitarist and singer-songwriter, formerly of Juno/Polaris-nominated YAMANTAKA // SONIC TITAN. His solo work blends Japanese-Canadian heritage with art rock, drawing comparisons to David Bowie and Animal Collective. His upcoming project, Isan (meaning “inheritance” in Japanese), reimagines early 20th-century Japanese-Christian hymns. He’ll preview songs ahead of its 2026 release. Charmie – Discover Canada’s gem, producer, artist, multi-instrumentalist, and songwriter Charmie. Born in Haiti and now living in Toronto, Charmie began exploring her musical talents at the young age of nine. Charlie’s style is a unique fusion of Rhythm & Blues and Pop Soul. Known for fostering a deep connection with her audiences busking on the streets of Toronto, Charmie’s words go straight from her heart to yours. Charmie recently wrote on GRAMMY Award winning artist Nelly Furtado’s latest album “7”, which has received extensive press coverage including in Vogue, NPR, and Forbes to name a few.

slim_seo.title: Michael Minelli - The Drake
slim_seo.description: When Michael Minelli sings, you know it’s him. With show-stopping delivery, dynamic range, and timeless panache, the Connecticut-born and raised entertainer immediately sets himself apart. If you’ve ever seen Michael live, you know the energy he brings is truly one of a kind. For Minelli, it’s all a matter of soul. “Soul is the core of everything,” he affirms. “It’s that thing you can’t put a finger on. Anytime somebody hears my music, I want them to immediately say, ‘That’s a Michael Minelli record.’” With over a decade of experience as an entertainer, Minelli has truly hit his stride—amassing over 200 million views across social media, more than 2 million followers, and over 30 million streams on his music. In 2024, he set the foundation with three support tours for Anees, Marc E. Bassy, and SonReal. Now in 2025, it’s time for Minelli to step into the spotlight as a headliner. One thing is for certain: this tour will be unlike anything he’s done before.

slim_seo.title: JO DOLO - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Jonathan-Ismaël Diaby, known as Jo Dolo, is a Montreal-based musician, actor, and former pro hockey player. After a career in the NHL system, he transitioned to hip-hop, blending personal storytelling with bold, bilingual lyricism. He stars as Dolo in the hit series Shoresy, where his real-life music also features.

slim_seo.title: GUNNR - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Gunnr, also known as Lil Gunnr, is a Canadian music artist, content creator, and preset mastermind who has made a major impact in the music production community. Renowned for his vocal and mastering presets, he’s become a go-to resource for aspiring producers looking to elevate their sound. His YouTube channel features tutorials where he breaks down signature tools like the Iayze Vocal Preset and All Around Master Preset, helping others achieve professional results with ease. While Gunnr first gained traction for his beat-making, he later shifted focus to perfecting and selling custom presets, carving out a unique niche that blends technical skill with a deep understanding of what artists need. His influence continues to grow as he supports fellow creators and pushes boundaries with his own work.

slim_seo.title: NoSo - The Drake
slim_seo.description: NoSo is the moniker of LA-based singer, songwriter, and producer Baek Hwong. Blending shimmering arrangements with unflinching introspection, Hwong crafts music that explores gender, identity, and intimacy with rare emotional clarity. Their 2025 sophomore album When Are You Leaving? follows the critically acclaimed debut Stay Proud of Me and marks a shift from daydream to reality—chronicling post-transition life, platonic heartbreak, and quiet victories with wit and vulnerability. A guitar virtuoso with a background in songwriting from USC’s Thornton School of Music, Hwong weaves sonic influences from new wave to experimental house into deeply personal, genre-blurring songs.

slim_seo.title: Max Fry - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Max Fry is a Florida-based producer, singer, and songwriter. He is known for his work in both electronica and indie/alt-pop, with a focus on creating immersive, emotionally-charged sonic landscapes.

slim_seo.title: New Constellations - The Drake
slim_seo.description: New Constellations – the ethereal brainchild of lifelong sidekicks Harlee Case and Josh Smith, and recent addition Kyle Farook – encapsulates a sonic dreamscape of eager melodies, striking guitar hooks, and celestial vocals that softly tangles listeners into a web of cosmic glory.   The Portland-based duo first explored collaborating when they were 14, recording a song together in Josh’s childhood bedroom, before spending the next 15 years exploring their individual approaches to music separately and eventually crafting the dynamic perspective that would become New Constellations. The two debuted with the single, “Hot Blooded,” an incomprehensibly magnetic voyage that offers warmth and compassion, and has now amassed over 45 million streams. Following a monumental year, Harlee and Josh continue to radiate their electrifying chemistry, now amplified by the addition of Kyle, a remarkable third member. With his exceptional musical prowess, Kyle infuses their live performances with a refreshing and captivating new energy. They are gearing themselves for an upcoming album release that can only be described as a continuation of their signature gilded alchemy.

slim_seo.title: The Dreggs - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Hailing from Australia’s indie-folk scene, The Dreggs—Paddy Macrae and Zane Harris—craft music rooted in raw emotion, rich harmonies, and storytelling that captures both the quiet and the anthemic. Growing up on the Sunshine Coast, their sound was shaped by coastal life and close friendship, evolving from stripped-back acoustic sets to expansive, heart-swelling live performances. Their debut album Caught in a Reverie blends folk tradition with modern edge, offering moments of vulnerability, joy, and reflection. Known for the intimacy they create on stage and the honesty they bring to every song, The Dreggs continue to carve a space that feels both deeply personal and universally resonant.

slim_seo.title: KATALYST - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Katalyst is back—crisscrossing the East Coast and Midwest with the raw energy and lush grooves of their new EP Speakeasy. This eight-piece sonic force has been weaving magic onstage and in the studio since their 2020 debut Nine Lives, building a universe where soul, funk, and jazz collide. With the Speakeasy East Tour, Katalyst invites you into an electrifying soundscape—part secret show, part cosmic ritual. The live experience is more than just a concert – it’s a full-body, mind-bending immersion.

slim_seo.title: Teethe - The Drake
slim_seo.description: On the new full-length album Magic Of The Sale, Teethe unveils their sad and beautiful self-built world of Southern slowcore, where the Texas band’s four distinct songwriters, singers, and artists ask a series of interlocked questions about what it means to build a life in a time of shared collapse. It’s an expansive next step for the band, whose 2020 self-titled debut morphed from a few early cassette runs into several sold-out vinyl editions, unlikely name-drops from mega-stars, and several tours across the United States and Europe. From a long-overlooked pocket of Texas’ musical wealth, Teethe re-emerges with a deeply layered and collaborative work that makes the weight of the world feel a little lighter to lug

slim_seo.title: Navan - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Get ready for an electrifying evening as Navan brings his acclaimed live show to The Drake Underground in Toronto! On July 11, 2025, experience the magnetic energy of one of Persian pop’s most innovative voices as he takes the stage at one of the city’s most iconic venues. Navan, known for blending modern Farsi melodies with alternative pop and R&B influences, will deliver a powerful set featuring a selection of his most loved releases—performed live with a band of world-class musicians. Renowned for his emotional performances and genre-defying sound, Navan creates an atmosphere where every note feels cinematic and every lyric hits home. Secure your tickets now and be part of an extraordinary night with Navan—where music knows no boundaries and every moment is pure magic.

slim_seo.title: Casey Lowrey - The Drake
slim_seo.description: When Casey Lowery’s grandfather passed away in 2023, he left him a caravan on the English coast—far from the music industry chaos Casey had spent years trying to make sense of. There, living with his dog and surrounded by nature, Casey reconnected with his roots and finished lekkerland, his debut album named after an Afrikaans word meaning “something pleasing.” Raised in Chesterfield and inspired by early 2000s pop icons, Casey chased fame as a teen, scoring a viral hit with “Trampoline” and landing a record deal—only to realize the pop machine wasn’t for him. Dropped during the pandemic, he returned home and found unexpected success on TikTok, where his funny, diaristic songs earned him millions of fans and a global touring career. Working closely with producer Raffer, Casey built lekkerland as a deeply personal, self-directed project, shaped by friendship, grief, therapy, and real-life stories. Tracks like “Not Ready,” “Caroline,” “Blue Cords,” and “Blood Line” reflect his mix of vulnerability and wit. Now with over 5 million followers, four sold-out tours, and his own management company, Casey is creating a more grounded, inclusive version of the music world—one where he and his fans can be entirely themselves.

slim_seo.title: Level Zero - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Born from our team’s love of raving and a mission to give back to the scene that shaped us, Level Zerø is all about creating a safe, inclusive space where you can show up as your raw, unfiltered self. ⁠ Sounds by: ⁠ @carts.dj ⁠ @mancan.music ⁠ @samstrutmusic ⁠ @tomb.raver.ofc ⁠ @turbo.ofc ⁠ ⁠ Presented by:⁠ @levels.ent & @rwndofficial ⁠

slim_seo.title: Shik Shook - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Join us Saturday, June 21 at The Drake Underground for our biggest ShikShook yet — it’s our One-Year Anniversary + Pride celebration, so you know we’re going all out.   Get ready for a night full of love, nonstop dancing, and queer Arab/SWANA joy with a stacked lineup you won’t want to miss:   Drag performances by Toronto faves Anoush Ellah & Selena Vyle — together on stage for the first time A special dance performance by the fierce Slaylat A live drumming set by Jenny C. DJ Romantek & DJ Ra2asny spinning Arabic top hits, old and new — plus some Assyrian and Armenian bangers in the mix   Foam sticks for early arrivals (first come, first serve!) Visuals featuring ShikShook memories & queer Arab/SWANA love on loop – want to be part of the visuals? Submit your favorite photo or video, or share a special message here to be featured on the projector during the party!   About ShikShook: ShikShook is a safe and inclusive party series created by the community, for the community. It’s a space where Arab/SWANA queer folks can connect, express themselves, and uplift one another. At ShikShook, we celebrate nostalgic Arabic tunes, freedom of self-expression, and authenticity. We’re also committed to giving back—a portion of each event’s profits supports urgent and essential causes. Proceeds from this event will directly benefit families across the Middle East.

slim_seo.title: Alicia Moffet - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Alicia Moffet is poised to take the world of pop music by storm. Born in Québec City, the 24-year-old singer-songwriter is already a superstar in her home country and is now making a name for herself internationally. With her distinctively soulful voice and bubbly personality, Alicia exudes a disarming charm and down-to-earth appeal. As a songwriter, she has a natural talent for translating real-life experiences into heartfelt lyrics and catchy melodies. Her sound blends the power of pop with the richness of R&B and soul, showcasing her powerhouse vocals across everything from dance-ready anthems to emotional ballads.

slim_seo.title: Wic Whitney - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Wic Whitney turns music into a dialogue—raw, honest, and full of perspective. Whether layering his words over rich hip-hop beats or smooth R&B soul instrumentation, he delivers stories that connect. The Arkansas-born, Chicago-based rapper, singer, and songwriter captures the essence of deep conversations, translating emotions and experiences into sound. With millions of streams and a growing presence, he continues to carve his own lane. His 2024 EPs Afternoon Reflections and Another Round [Nettwerk Music Group] further showcase his artistry. Since his breakout Tide Pools EP in 2017, he has steadily built momentum, following up with The Sunshine Couch EP, which featured the standout “Mama’s Song.” In 2023, “Matcha” racked up over 1.5 million Spotify streams and earned praise from Glide Magazine and beyond. He carried that momentum into 2024 with Afternoon Reflections and the standout track “Oolong.” Now, splitting time between Chicago and LA, he’s fine-tuning his upcoming 2025 LP, continuing to push his sound forward.

slim_seo.title: Charlotte Lawrence - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Charlotte Lawrence is an American singer-songwriter known for her emotionally charged lyrics and genre-blending pop sound. With standout tracks, she has built a loyal fanbase drawn to her raw honesty and dynamic vocals.

slim_seo.title: "LIKKLE BIT" PRIDE AP w/ Ohbumbarassclot - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Two floors. Two different moods. LIKKLE BIT – PRE-PRIDE AFTER PARTY (8pm – 11pm ) BOXKILLABRITT TANGERINE SKYLÆR KANDÁÁMORA LIKKLE BIT – PRIDE AFTER PARTY (12am – 3am ) Just a likkle bit of everything you love, and a whole lot of what you need! Upstairs is serving iconic gay anthems, club classics, and those songs that make you scream, “THIS IS MY SONG!” 🚨 $50 flash tattoos upstairs 🚨 BEEYOND INK TATTOO KAIZIEE ( @kaizbeetattoos ) TAMEICA (@sarg3_the_tattooist ) WE ALSO HAVE A PHOTO BOOTH ! JAYDE (@stillmagicphotos) bur here is the dj rundown- Downstairs? Pure Caribbean fire. We talking SOCA. We talking DANCEHALL. We talking AFROBEATS. Expect high energy, sweaty whines, and unforgettable vibes. And yes this party SELLS OUT every year because it’s THAT girl. Plus, we got surprises up our sleeve giveaways, prizes, and more throughout the night. So show up, show out, and celebrate Pride the Caribbean way. DJs UPSTAIRS POGI ACE DILLINGER REDLINERS SOUND BOI DJs DOWNSTAIRS PRESTIGE DJ SWAGS COOKIEDOH CHANL MARSHL   LIKKLE BIT ISNT A PEANUT FREE PARTY (there might be snacks that contain peanuts.) All ticket sales are FINAL SALE, NO REFUNDS

slim_seo.title: Underground Pride - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Back for year two, Underground Pride is taking over the Drake Underground. This is for the culture, for the ones that know the roots. The ballroom kids, the club rats, the drag disruptors. We’re keeping it grassroots, keeping it real, and keeping it cheap. Thanks to our incredible partners, your entry is only $15 and comes with a $5 vodka bar courtesy of @hvospringwatervodka @redbullcanada @sipsapsucker Featuring: Artin Avaznia, LEXXICON, Kehiw, Mix Signals and Toussaint. Artin Avaznia, Solo Dance Artist As a solo dance artist, Artin Avaznia is revolutionizing the way that dance is consumed and perceived. As dance is most often relegated to the shadows, Artin has been advocating and ultimately leading a career that steps out of these shadows and into the spotlight. He is the first solo dance artist in history to perform @ MTL Pride and Pride Toronto, he also headlined the first edition of Underground Pride. His work has been featured on CTV’s Etalk, CBC, CTV News, BlogTO LEXXICON, Recording Artist Lexxicon is a trailblazing Dancehall/Hip-Hop artist, renowned for his unique infusion of Moombahton, Dembow, Reggaeton and upbeat dancehall rhythms.Musically influenced by heavyweights like Sean Paul, Bad Bunny, Stefflon Don and Spice, Lexxicon’s sound is a vibrant testament to his heritage and his bold, eclectic personal style.Lexxicon’s journey is one marked by passion and perseverance, earning acclaim from major media platforms including Billboard, Revolt TV, Complex, 6ixbuzz, Exclaim, Breakfast Television, e-Talk, NOW Magazine, and CBC Radio. KEHIW, DJ KEHIW is a Tsuut’ina and Cree DJ, producer, and creative visionary whose sound merges Indigenous influence with the pulse of underground electronic music. Now based in Los Angeles, his sets are genre-fluid, globally inspired, and charged with raw emotional depth.Shaped by his time in Toronto’s underground scene, KEHIW developed a distinctive style that blends storytelling, rhythm, and intention — driving his commitment to both musical craft and cultural representation. Deeply connected to the roots of house, techno, and queer club culture, he centers Indigenous and 2SLGBTQ+ communities in every performance.KEHIW isn’t just playing music — he’s curating space, building community, and pushing boundaries with every beat. Mix Signals, DJ Mix Signals is a dynamic DJ duo composed of Demi and Jacey, two talented artists with a passion for electronic music that bring a fresh and exhilarating energy to the stage. They’ve shared the stage with iconic artists like M.I.A., Keys n Krates and Pat Lok, and captivated audiences across the globe, with unforgettable performances in Jamaica and Mexico City. Together, they create a unique fusion of beats that fill a void in the DJ industry. With their eclectic style and undeniable chemistry, they bring a high-energy experience that keeps dancefloors moving. Toussaint, Recording Artist Meet Toussaint: a boundary-breaking singer/songwriter at the intersection of experimental pop, alternative R&B, neo-electronica, rock and ambient realms. Their art, shaped by classical piano training and a diverse performing arts background, defies convention and embraces a visceral approach. Toussaint’s sonic journey unfolds in their debut EP, “Ethereal,” and a sold-out release concert, marking her commitment to storytelling, world-building, and immersive performance art. As an alumni of the RBC X Artscape Launchpad Music Entrepreneurship Program, Soundstock, and Small World Music they’re not just an artist but an entrepreneur. www.artinavaznia.com

slim_seo.title: Gyal Segment - The Drake
slim_seo.description: More Details Soon

slim_seo.title: Ardn - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Canadian-raised singer/songwriter ARDN is making waves in hip-hop with his unique blend of melodic flow, raw storytelling, and soul-infused sound. A first-generation immigrant, ARDN channels personal experiences into music that resonates deeply. With viral hits like “Til The Morning” and “Jupiter & Mars,” plus a standout EP She, ARDN continues to rise. Catch him live as he previews his highly anticipated new project, Keep Your Eye on the Sparrow. Don’t miss this powerful voice shaping the future of hip-hop.

slim_seo.title: New Constellations - The Drake
slim_seo.description: New Constellations – the ethereal brainchild of lifelong sidekicks Harlee Case and Josh Smith, and recent addition Kyle Farook – encapsulates a sonic dreamscape of eager melodies, striking guitar hooks, and celestial vocals that softly tangles listeners into a web of cosmic glory.   The Portland-based duo first explored collaborating when they were 14, recording a song together in Josh’s childhood bedroom, before spending the next 15 years exploring their individual approaches to music separately and eventually crafting the dynamic perspective that would become New Constellations. The two debuted with the single, “Hot Blooded,” an incomprehensibly magnetic voyage that offers warmth and compassion, and has now amassed over 45 million streams. Following a monumental year, Harlee and Josh continue to radiate their electrifying chemistry, now amplified by the addition of Kyle, a remarkable third member. With his exceptional musical prowess, Kyle infuses their live performances with a refreshing and captivating new energy. They are gearing themselves for an upcoming album release that can only be described as a continuation of their signature gilded alchemy.

slim_seo.title: Francesco Yates - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Francesco Yates is a diamond-selling singer/songwriter/producer. His hit song with Robin Shultz, “Sugar”, has over a billion streams and was named by Spotify as one of the top 50 dance songs of all time. He has played stages around the world, including touring with such artists as Justin Timberlake and The Backstreet Boys. Francesco is returning to his R&B and pop-rock roots late this spring with his next EP “Acapella”, featuring the singles “Acapella” and “Better Half”. Please join us for this special show and help celebrate the release of “Acapella”.

slim_seo.title: Breaking Sound - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Breaking Sound Canada is a premier live music showcase spotlighting the hottest emerging artists in intimate venues across Toronto. With a commitment to bridging the gap between unsigned and signed talent, each event features 4–5 artists delivering dynamic 30-minute sets. These showcases offer a unique opportunity to experience fresh sounds in a vibrant, community-driven atmosphere.​

slim_seo.title: Full Crate - The Drake
slim_seo.description: A truly versatile artist with roots spanning in R&B, Soul, Hip Hop, Electronic and beyond, Full Crate continues to push the boundaries of contemporary music. Renowned for his collaborations with a diverse array of artists, including BJ The Chicago Kid, Gaidaa, D Smoke, Naomi Sharon and many more, he has also garnered acclaim for his remixes, most notably his interpretation of Beyoncé’s “XO” and his Grammy-considered remix of Jungle’s “Back on 74.” In 2023, he released his debut album, A Kid From Yerevan, a deeply personal project that reflects on his experiences as an immigrant and highlights his evolution as an artist. His unique blend of styles has established him as a significant figure in underground music culture. Full Crate’s influence has reached wider audiences, with Rihanna featuring his tracks in her Savage x Fenty lingerie shows on two occasions. His music has also been prominently featured in the Emmy-winning Netflix series When They See Us. With millions of streams under his belt—70 million for his track “A Storm On A Summers Day” and 12 million for his remix of Jungle’s “Back On 74”—Full Crate’s sound has resonated across various platforms. His work has also appeared in high-profile campaigns, including David Yurman’s advertisement featuring Michael B. Jordan. Looking ahead, Full Crate is set to continue his impressive trajectory after a successful debut album and a sold-out tour across North America. With headlining performances in major cities like Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, and New York, he consistently showcases his evolution as both a multi-disciplinary performer and an innovator, crafting a soulful, genre-defying sound that resonates globally.

slim_seo.title: Full Crate - The Drake
slim_seo.description: A truly versatile artist with roots spanning in R&B, Soul, Hip Hop, Electronic and beyond, Full Crate continues to push the boundaries of contemporary music. Renowned for his collaborations with a diverse array of artists, including BJ The Chicago Kid, Gaidaa, D Smoke, Naomi Sharon and many more, he has also garnered acclaim for his remixes, most notably his interpretation of Beyoncé’s “XO” and his Grammy-considered remix of Jungle’s “Back on 74.” In 2023, he released his debut album, A Kid From Yerevan, a deeply personal project that reflects on his experiences as an immigrant and highlights his evolution as an artist. His unique blend of styles has established him as a significant figure in underground music culture. Full Crate’s influence has reached wider audiences, with Rihanna featuring his tracks in her Savage x Fenty lingerie shows on two occasions. His music has also been prominently featured in the Emmy-winning Netflix series When They See Us. With millions of streams under his belt—70 million for his track “A Storm On A Summers Day” and 12 million for his remix of Jungle’s “Back On 74”—Full Crate’s sound has resonated across various platforms. His work has also appeared in high-profile campaigns, including David Yurman’s advertisement featuring Michael B. Jordan. Looking ahead, Full Crate is set to continue his impressive trajectory after a successful debut album and a sold-out tour across North America. With headlining performances in major cities like Los Angeles, San Francisco, Chicago, and New York, he consistently showcases his evolution as both a multi-disciplinary performer and an innovator, crafting a soulful, genre-defying sound that resonates globally.

slim_seo.title: Robyn Hitchcock (Day 1) - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Robyn Hitchcock is a legendary British singer-songwriter whose surrealist lyricism and genre-blurring catalog span six decades. A singular voice in music, his work is rich with recurring themes like marine life, obsolete electric transport, ghosts, cheese, and what one writer described as “morbid eroticism.” From fronting The Soft Boys’ psychedelic art-rock to crafting cult solo classics like I Often Dream of Trains and Eye, Hitchcock blends psychedelia, wit, and emotional depth with poetic ease. Now based in Nashville, he continues to evolve creatively—publishing books, releasing music through his own Tiny Ghost label, and collaborating across continents. With new songs set for release in 2025, Hitchcock remains an enduring icon of inventive rock. “I like to keep busy,” says Hitchcock. “We have all eternity to not exist.”

slim_seo.title: Spill Tab - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Spill tab is the genre-defying project of French-Korean artist Claire Chicha, whose infectious blend of indie pop, raw guitar-driven confessions, and experimental soundscapes has made her a standout voice in alternative music. Her debut album ANGIE marks a bold creative turning point—fueled by personal freedom and sonic exploration. With roots in LA and global influences spanning jazz, grunge, and French chanson, spill tab crafts music that’s fearless, emotional, and refreshingly unpredictable.

slim_seo.title: REMY BOND - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Remy Bond creates timeless pop anthems steeped in nostalgia and cinematic allure. Blending vintage aesthetics with contemporary lyricism, her music invites listeners into a world where the golden age of Hollywood meets modern-day sensibilities. Her breakout single, “Summer Song,” launched her into the spotlight, amassing over 12 million streams and securing radio airplay. The track’s extreme success on TikTok propelled it to #2 on the Viral 50 USA Spotify charts before finally landing her the prestigious #1 spot on Spotify’s Fresh Finds Class of 2024. Building on this momentum, Remy would release standout singles “Don’t Go Back to Paris” and “Star Shaped Baby”, two beautiful songs infused with a sense of nostalgia and endless yearning. Along with their iconic music videos, these tracks would allow the rising artist to develop a deeply personalized aesthetic atmosphere that early fans resonated with and later took part in re-imagining through social media. Early on, Remy’s emphasis on visual artistry would distinguish her work as truly unique. Her music videos, often directed by her talented 18-year-old sister Olivia Bond, showcase her larger-than-life creative vision. Fans feel at home in the Remy Bond cinematic universe, one characterized by a sense of blissful extravagance. Remy’s historic debut show at The Roxy in Los Angeles was a sold-out affair, with over a thousand fans crowding the sidewalk for a chance to witness her leadoff performance. She continually brings an aura of lavishness to her stages, which she fills with burlesque dancers, giant martini glasses, and 6-feet-tall wedding cakes that she emerges from. Her most recent song Simple Girl has been breaking the internet. The track meshes rhythmic and melodic elements inspired by ABBA’s music with modern Synth and Bedroom Pop characteristics. The lyrics are witty and playful, as Remy hits notes no one even knew were possible to sing when delivering them. Recently, Remy’s music made major appearances on Amazon Music’s 2025 Indie Artist to Watch list, Zane Lowe’s 25 for ‘25 list for Apple Music, and InStyle’s 2025 Musicians to Watch list. This precedes the 19-year old rising star’s signing with Warner Records and Sony/ATV Publishing, a huge step in her career that will allow her to raise the ceiling even higher on what she can achieve Needless to say, no one can wait to see what Remy has in store for us in this new year. Her US nationwide and Europe tours that will spark off the release of her upcoming album are generating immense levels of hype across the music industry. There’s no doubt we’re due for a Remy Bond takeover in 202

slim_seo.title: Young Friend - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Drew Tarves, aka young friend, makes music that blends nostalgic indie-pop with raw emotion, capturing the highs and lows of growing up. His debut album Motorcycle Sound Effects is a genre-blurring exploration of first love, heartbreak, self-doubt, and fleeting moments—like dancing barefoot at sunset or driving aimlessly with friends. A former dancer turned musician, the 24-year-old Vancouver native has earned a Juno nomination and toured internationally, crafting songs that feel both fresh and timeless. Produced by David Marinelli, the album is a coming-of-age soundtrack full of energy, honesty, and heart.

slim_seo.title: Button Masher - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Jake Silverman, also known as Button Masher, is a GRAMMY-winning arranger, electronic musician, composer and educator. In 2018, Silverman began to experiment with combining Jazz Fusion with chiptune. Since that time, Silverman’s genre bending music has garnered popularity with jazz lovers and video games fans from all over the world. He received the 2021 GRAMMY Award for Best Arrangement: Instrumental or A Cappella for his and Charlie Rosen’s arrangement of “Meta Knight’s Revenge” as recorded by the 8-Bit Big Band. In 2024 he was nominated for a second GRAMMY for his work with Charlie Rosen on arrangement of “The Last Surprise” in the category of Best Arrangement: Instruments and Vocals. Button Masher can be heard with notable artists such as Phoenix, The 8-Bit Big Band, Evan Marien, Adam Neely, Sungazer, Andrew Huang, Dj Cutman, and many more.

slim_seo.title: Johnny Manchild + Fake Shark - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Johnny Manchild and the Poor Bastards is an American multi-genre ensemble founded by Johnny Manchild.Since its founding in 2016, the band took the internet by storm, with a unique conundrum of jazz idioms, grunge, alt-rock, world music, and funk that prompted even Anthony Fantano himself (known as “The Only Music Critic Who Matters” by the NYT) ask “what gives them the right to be this good? ” The Bastards have since answered that question, drawing from a dedicated and thriving fanbase that is bound together by a deep love of music, lyricism, engineering and sonic exploration. From their hometown of Oklahoma City to the global stage, each release has been a marked discovery not just for the fans, but the Poor Bastards themselves. With 18+ million streams, 4 albums, and new sonic horizons to be crossed, the Poor Bastards have morphed into a collective of sorts with as many as 10 collaborators (affectionately “Bastards”) in regular rotation, with Johnny Manchild at the helm. Fake Shark is an eccentric indie garage rock band known for their eclectic sound. The group seamlessly blends classic punk and new wave, with chart topping indie pop and garage rock hits to create a unique and dynamic listening experience. Since their formation, Fake Shark has captivated audiences with their high-energy performances and inventive approach to songwriting. The band consists of charismatic frontman Kevvy, whose bold vocal style and stage presence are matched by his talents as a producer and songwriter (with diverse writing and production collaborations with such artists as Carly Rae Jepsen and Dave Grohl). Joining him are the equally talented Louis Wu on guitar, Jake Fox on keys and guitar, and Alex Glassford on drums, each bringing their distinct musical influences and technical prowess to the mix. Fake Shark has released several critically acclaimed albums and singles, earning them a dedicated fanbase and numerous accolades within the music industry. They have toured extensively across Asia, Canada, and Europe, further solidifying their international appeal. The band boasts a top 10 hit song and two top 20 hit songs at rock radio, including several appearances on the North American billboard charts, showcasing their ability to resonate with a broad audience. Their innovative music videos and visually stunning live shows involving theatrics, crowd work and elements of comedy have cemented their reputation as a must-see act. Additionally, their music has been featured in high-profile placements such as Apple commercials, the reality TV shows Love Island and Catfish, The NHL playoffs, NFL Monday Night Football and on Netflix and MTV, not to mention in publications such as Billboard Magazine and The Globe and Mail. Always pushing the boundaries of their sound, Fake Shark continues to evolve and surprise listeners with each new release, making them one of the most exciting bands to watch in the modern music sc

slim_seo.title: Nate Sib - The Drake
slim_seo.description: 20-year-old Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Nate Sib approaches pop from an enigmatic perspective, bringing shocking, irresistible, and infectious anthems to life with electronic dance music energy and alternative experimentation twisted up with just the right amount of basement-born trap grit. Under the influence of Justin Bieber, Skrillex, deadmau5, and Future, Sib wrote and recorded original music introducing himself as an artist with “Why can’t you see” which organically landing a high-profile sync on EA Sports NHL 24. Teaming up with his friend kimj, he dropped the for you EP highlighted by “down” and “wish.” He then maintained this momentum with “famous” and inked a deal with Republic. He hit the road touring alongside childhood best friend and fellow buzzing disruptor 2hollis. After piling up millions of streams and views independently, he ambitiously endeavors to soundtrack the future with a series of 2025 singles and anticipated new EP in Spring 2025.

slim_seo.title: Big Gay Night - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Toronto artist CJ Wiley will be celebrating the release of her powerful debut album, So Brand New. The night promises music, (line)dancing, and unapologetic queer joy, with a special performance by Nardos Almaz. CJ’s album dives deep into themes of reinvention, queer love, nostalgia, and addiction—offering a raw, cathartic journey of burning it all down to begin again. Come through for an unforgettable night of emotion and liberation.

slim_seo.title: YALLA - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Welcome to Yalla Comedy, a night filled with the best Comedians either from our City or Passing through.

slim_seo.title: DJ LEX - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Lex is hitting Toronto as part of her Lex and the City Tour for the first time for a party filled with her favorite remixes, edits, flips, r&b, house, hiphop & more!

slim_seo.title: Poetry Slam - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Join us on May 24th for our Canadian Individual Poetry Slam Qualifier! Winner will receive money and be our CIPS rep. Interested in competing? Have three poems ready to go, a 1 min, a 2min, and a 3min poem, sign up is at the venue at 7pm. There are limited open mic spots available if you are interested in competing.

slim_seo.title: Ryan Ellis - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Ryan Ellis is a GRAMMY-nominated, Dove Award-winning singer-songwriter whose music blends worship, R&B, and hip hop to foster unity and spread the love of Jesus. Known for his Billboard charting hits “I Thank God” and “Heart of the Father,” Ellis’s latest album Real Love explores themes of empathy, personal struggle, and faith, with a focus on reaching overlooked communities. Raised in a military family with Filipino roots, Ellis’s perspective is shaped by diverse experiences, including his time in the Navy and personal loss. His honest lyrics, paired with upbeat melodies, reflect his desire to connect people through shared experiences of grief, love, and healing. With a heart for collaboration, Ellis has worked with artists like Chris Tomlin and Maverick City Music, and his viral hit “Better Days” resonates deeply with fans facing their own challenges. Through Real Love, Ellis aims to create a soundtrack of hope, offering a message of unity and the transformative power of God’s love.

title.rendered: Teen Jesus and The Jean Teasers

slim_seo.title: Teen Jesus and The Jean Teasers - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers are a fierce four-piece from Canberra making waves with their post-grunge, alt-rock energy. Known for their raw live shows and bold sound, the band’s debut album “I Love You” earned critical praise and led to sold-out tours and major festival slots. Now signed to Mom + Pop Music, their deluxe release “I Love You Too” features collabs with Softcult and The Linda Lindas, proving they’re a rising powerhouse in today’s rock scene.

slim_seo.title: Others People's Treasure BINGO - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Get ready for a night of unexpected fun at Other People’s Treasure BINGO—where vintage vibes, quirky prizes, and community energy collide! Join us for a playful twist on classic bingo, featuring unique “treasures” up for grabs, music to keep the mood right, and surprises around every corner. Whether you’re in it to win or just along for the ride, this isn’t your grandma’s bingo night… it’s way better.

slim_seo.title: Changing Currents - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Known for his dynamic blends of electronic beats, ambient soundscapes, and cutting-edge rhythms, Changing Currents is a rising force in the DJ scene. With a knack for creating unforgettable atmospheres, his sets take audiences on a journey through smooth transitions and high-energy drops. Whether you’re a die-hard fan or new to his sound, don’t miss this opportunity to experience the unique vibe of Changing Currents at this must-attend event!

slim_seo.title: Emily Nenni - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Emily Nenni never expected to become a performer, but the Nashville-based singer and guitarist has carved out a distinct place in the country scene with her fiery blend of honky-tonk, soul, and rock ‘n’ roll. Known for her sharp, heartfelt songwriting and captivating live shows, she’s spent years building her voice and vision in smoky bars and clubs across Music City—culminating in her new album, Drive & Cry. A bold follow-up to 2022’s On the Ranch, Drive & Cry finds Nenni firmly rooted in her Nashville world, drawing inspiration from dive bars like Santa’s Pub and channeling personal experiences into every track. With help from producer John James Tourville and a circle of close friends, she crafted a record that is unfiltered, empowering, and entirely her own—proof that she was always meant to take center stage.

slim_seo.title: Breaking Sound - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Breaking Sound Canada is a premier live music showcase spotlighting the hottest emerging artists in intimate venues across Toronto. With a commitment to bridging the gap between unsigned and signed talent, each event features 4–5 artists delivering dynamic 30-minute sets. These showcases offer a unique opportunity to experience fresh sounds in a vibrant, community-driven atmosphere.​

slim_seo.title: Audrey Nuna - The Drake
slim_seo.description: New Jersey and LA-based artist Audey Nuna is a genre-blurring singer, rapper, and songwriter known for her bold fusion of pop, R&B, and experimental trap. With razor-sharp lyrics and striking visuals, she crafts anthems of nonconformity and originality. Her visionary approach shines through in self-directed music videos and critically-acclaimed albums *a liquid breakfast* and *TRENCH*, released last October, cementing her reputation as a fearless creative force redefining the boundaries of modern music.

slim_seo.title: Sunday (1994) - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Sunday (1994) is a cinematic love story told through music—born from a decade-long collaboration between Paige Turner and Lee Newell, whose effortless connection turns tender lyrics and emotional soundscapes into a heartfelt soundtrack of romance, longing, and trust. Joined by their mysterious drummer ‘x’, the trio crafts songs that feel like scenes from a film—intimate, dramatic, and timeless.

slim_seo.title: HENNY UP - The Drake
slim_seo.description: The event is an annual party thrown by DJ Trizzy called Henny Up. The party will feature a variety of music genres covering sounds from the Caribbean (Soca, Bouyon, Dancehall), Africa (Afrobeats, Amapiano), R&B, Hip-Hop and much more. Anyone attending the event will experience a culturally rich musical journey like no other as we celebrate the 10th Anniversary of this event!

slim_seo.title: Friyie - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Toronto rapper Friyie made waves with his 2017 viral hit “Money Team,” used by Floyd Mayweather as a walkout anthem. His debut project ANF: Ain’t Nothing Free featured Roddy Ricch and Tory Lanez, earning acclaim from Complex and Vice. With follow-up albums Before the Flight and Off The Map, and collaborations with Bun B and TeaMarrr, Friyie blends sharp storytelling with global ambition—delivering confident, focused music that charts his unique path in hip-hop.

slim_seo.title: La French: Season Finale - The Drake
slim_seo.description: La French is back at the Drake Underground for an unforgettable night on Saturday, May 3, 2025 at 10:30 PM—our season finale! Get ready for an amazing night with special guest DJ TrayBaby alongside our resident DJs, Sevenstyle and Le Curateur, bringing you the best of Francophone music: Afrobeat, Hip-Hop, Zouk, and more. Join us as we celebrate one last time before the summer break. Stay tuned for special events throughout the summer and catch us again in October for a brand-new season at the Drake Underground. Don’t miss this grand finale—it’s going to be epic! ***** FRENCH BELOW ***** La French revient au Drake Underground pour une soirée exceptionnelle, le samedi 3 mai 2025 dès 22h30, pour clôturer en beauté la saison. Préparez-vous à vivre une nuit mémorable, portée par nos DJs invités : l’incontournable DJ TrayBaby, accompagné de nos résidents Sevenstyle et Le Curateur aux commandes du son. Venez célébrer une dernière fois avant l’été, avec le meilleur des musiques francophones d’Afrobeat, Hip-Hop, Zouk et plus encore. Ambiance festive garantie ! Ce n’est qu’un au revoir : rendez-vous tout au long de l’été pour d’autres événements spéciaux, et retrouvez-nous dès octobre pour une nouvelle saison au Drake Underground. Ne manquez pas la grande finale de La French — ça va être incroyable!

slim_seo.title: Louyah - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Louyah is a Staten Island-born singer-songwriter making waves with his explosive blend of alt-pop, rock, R&B, and rap. After years in the metal scene, he broke out solo with the viral hit “I Used to Care,” gaining millions of streams and a passionate fanbase. Known for his raw, emotional lyrics and powerful vocals, Louyah brings an electrifying energy to every performance. Don’t miss your chance to experience one of the most genre-defying and honest voices in today’s music scene.

slim_seo.title: Tashan - The Drake
slim_seo.description: This May, Tashan teams up with @pridetoronto and @theprepclinic to celebrate Asian Heritage Month with Humraaz—an electrifying Indo-House music event . Blending South Asian culture with global electronic sounds, Humraaz is a vibrant tribute to LGBTQ+ resilience and heritage. Dance to cutting-edge Indo-House beats while honoring community and identity. Plus, connect with The PrEP Clinic (@theprepclinic) for trusted, confidential HIV prevention and sexual health services. Celebrate pride, culture, and music all in one unforgettable night.

slim_seo.title: Adam Melchor - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Adam Melchor is a rising indie pop singer-songwriter known for his heartfelt lyrics, soothing vocals, and genre-blending sound. With roots in classical voice and a background in opera, he brings a unique depth to songs about love, vulnerability, and self-discovery. His acclaimed projects, including Melchor Lullaby Hotline, Vol. 1 and Here Goes Nothing!, have earned praise from Billboard and SPIN. Having toured with Mt. Joy and Dodie, Adam delivers a live performance full of intimacy, warmth, and emotional resonance.

slim_seo.title: Sadboi (Day 2) *SOLD OUT* - The Drake
slim_seo.description: SadBoi is one of Toronto’s most compelling rising stars, known for her raw lyricism, genre-blending sound, and magnetic stage presence. Fusing Caribbean roots with introspective storytelling, she’s built a loyal following through hits like “DESLIZA,” “Cunty,” and “Therapist.” Fearlessly authentic, SadBoi’s artistry caught the attention of Drake, affirming her bold, evolving voice. Beyond music, her ever-changing style and her devoted fanbase—the CryBabiez—highlight her impact as a cultural force who champions honesty, self-expression, and individuality.

slim_seo.title: Sadboi (Day 1) *SOLD OUT* - The Drake
slim_seo.description: SadBoi is one of Toronto’s most compelling rising stars, known for her raw lyricism, genre-blending sound, and magnetic stage presence. Fusing Caribbean roots with introspective storytelling, she’s built a loyal following through hits like “DESLIZA,” “Cunty,” and “Therapist.” Fearlessly authentic, SadBoi’s artistry caught the attention of Drake, affirming her bold, evolving voice. Beyond music, her ever-changing style and her devoted fanbase—the CryBabiez—highlight her impact as a cultural force who champions honesty, self-expression, and individuality.

slim_seo.title: Sammy Rash - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Sammy Rash is a 22-year-old breakout artist known for crafting deeply personal, feel-good music straight from his garage. With a sound rooted in raw emotion, sun-soaked vibes, and DIY charm, his songs have quickly struck a chord with a passionate fanbase. Blending acoustic pop with introspective lyrics, Sammy’s music feels like a conversation with a friend. Beloved for his genuine personality, he actively engages with fans on Instagram (@sammyrash). His rise reflects a new wave of artists building connection through authenticity.

slim_seo.title: Khantrast - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Khantrast is one of NYC’s most exciting rising stars, breaking out with his viral hit Landed In Brooklyn, which has racked up over 16 million streams. Known for blending gritty New York energy with global influences, he’s gained support from major names like Twitch icon Kai Cenat. His remix with Kyle Richh showcases his bold presence in the scene. With a growing fanbase and unstoppable momentum, Khantrast isn’t just making noise—he’s shaping the future of NYC rap.

slim_seo.title: Puma Blue - The Drake
slim_seo.description: Experience the haunting, soulful sound of Puma Blue, the alias of artist and producer Jacob Allen. Known for his falsetto vocals, lo-fi textures, and jazz-infused live shows, Puma Blue delivers intimate, nocturnal music that captivates audiences. With acclaimed releases like In Praise Of Shadows and Holy Waters, his work blends romance, experimentation, and raw emotion. Having collaborated with Loyle Carner and Biig Piig, and praised for his visual art and poetry, Puma Blue brings a truly immersive performance you won’t forget.
